intro: Cupania verapazensis, commonly known as the Verapaz cupania, is a flowering plant species native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments, often in lowland forests or along riverbanks. Its botanical features include a woody stem and capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cupania verapazensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
